a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Relative coverage of causes of death in the New York Times (NYT),
Relative coverage of articles mentioning the top 10 causes of death in the USA (in addition to terrorism, homicide and drug
overdoses) in the New York Times (NYT). This is based on the number of articles which mention any of the terms or
synonym/related terms (e.g. 'murder' for homicide) in the headline or body text. This is normalized to the relative share by
dividing by the total number of articles which feature any of these causes of death.
Data source: Shen et al. (2018). Based on the New York Times article database.
